Abstract: The integration of machine learning, graphical processing units (GPUs), and cloud computing is revolutionizing interactive quantum chemistry, enabling real-time simulations and analyses. This study explores the synergy between these technologies to enhance natural user interfaces and chemical structure recognition, facilitating more intuitive and efficient workflows for chemists. By leveraging the computational power of GPUs and the scalability of cloud resources, complex quantum chemical calculations can be performed interactively, providing immediate feedback and visualization. Extended reality technologies further augment this experience, offering immersive environments for exploring molecular structures and reactions. This approach not only accelerates research and discovery but also democratizes access to advanced quantum chemistry tools, making them accessible to a broader scientific community. The implications for education, research, and industry are profound, promising significant advancements in chemical sciences.
